text: thumb Klin (sk. Klin, pl. Starorobociański Wierch) is a peak in the Western Tatras, on the border between Slovakia and Poland. Its summit is at 2,176 m AMSL. It is the highest peak in Polish Western Tatras. The foreground is a classic split ridge or doppelgrat, spreading under tension due to deep erosion in the valleys either side. The finest example in the Tatra is between Kamienista and Smreczynski Wierch nearby. Klin Klin Category:Poland–Slovakia border Category:International mountains of Europe Category:Western Tatras Category:Mountains of the Western Carpathians
title: Klin (mountain)
